meanings.sent1: She is revalidating her passport before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The company is revalidating the expired licenses of its employees.
meanings.sent3: After revalidating her parking ticket, she realized she had parked in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent4: The scientist is revalidating the results of the experiment to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent5: Revalidating the contract will give us peace of mind.

meanings.definition: To confirm the validity of again
meanings.sent1: The bank is revalidating the customer's account information.
meanings.sent2: He revalidating his membership to access the exclusive benefits.
meanings.sent3: The detective is revalidating the alibi of the suspect.
meanings.sent4: Revalidating the warranty saved him from unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent5: Revalidating the data is crucial for the accuracy of the report.
